result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank C. Hamer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Frank C. Hamer appeared with Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  8:11 am court calls case and recites appearances.  Judge appears via video. State recites plea - plea to misd. poss. drug para with 30 days jail and $500.00 fine.  Atty Anderson states he was free to argue and not a joint agreement.  Court questions defendant as to plea questionnaire.   State moved to amend to misd. possess drug para. and count 1 would be dismissed and used as a read-in.   Court grants motion to amend.  Defendant enters plea of guilty as to count 2.  Count 1 is dismissed and used as read-in.  State argues sentencing continue on probation 1 year.  Atty Anderson makes arguement as to sentencing / fine is requested.  Court questions parties as to when probation is completed.  Defendant addressed the Court.

COURT:  Fine of $300.00 plus cost to be calculated by the clerk

Defendant, Frank C. Hamer appeared with Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Atty Anderson offer was made not acceptable requests another stc.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on February 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.

records.addlTxt: Atty Anderson waived reading entered plea of not guilty - officer Harrington was an officer involved.  Court will recuse

Defendant, Frank C. Hamer appeared with Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Attorney Frost  appeared for the State.  8:47 AM Court calls case and recites appearances.  Dave Wilson called - sworn by deputy clerk - examined Atty Frost.  Cross-examined Atty Anderson.  Re-direct Atty Frost.  State makes arguement.  Atty Anderson makes arguement.

Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial
Preliminary hearing on December 4, 2014 at 08:45 am.
for Appointment of Counsel, Affidavit of Indigency and Order

Defendant, Frank C. Hamer appeared.  Defendant waived time limits.  Court will appoint Bruce Anderson.  Bail will continue.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 21, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Defendant, Frank C. Hamer appeared.  Court questions defendant re: attorney.  Defendant has not rec'd complaint.  DA tendered complaint to Defendant.  Defendant waived reading.  Court NG plea entered count 2.  Defendant to speak to public defender.
